intro: Batatas heterophylla, commonly known as the sweet potato vine, is a member of the Convolvulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its trailing growth habit and vibrant foliage. The plant produces heart-shaped leaves that can range in color from green to variegated patterns of white, yellow, and red. Its tuberous roots, which are edible, are typically harvested after the first frost. Batatas heterophylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
